page.title: 03Amery Lodge Farm (l)
page.content: This old property is a very good example of how old farm houses have been converted into many homes, generally built around the old farm yard and incorporating the out buildings. Reference to North Lyttleton can be found in the Domesday Book (note change of spelling). The first reference to Amery Lodge was made during the Civil War. The property and land was owned by the Sandys family. There were three brothers who fought for the Royalist cause and as a consequence they lost their land and home. They also quarrelled with Charles 11 and their lands were given to the Crown.Early in the Cl8th Queen Anne gave the farm and land to the Churchill family and it became part of the Blenheim Estate.
